div.div: Created new branch reorg_examples_script.schema.json in buildtesters/buildtest
Commented on #1446 add code coverage for retrying tests (buildtest build --retry)

@Mendi03 here are few hints for you to get started The test method run will return if exit code is a 0 or when its run on a local executor because non-zero exit code tests should stop executing as pose to keep running again. https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/6b6277ce0429acb1b0edd332e253233c24789745/buildtest/builders/base.py#L378-L379 For instance if you look at this example test https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/devel/tutorials/test_status/pass_returncode.yml simply running a exit 1 will cause test to fail. That being said we do need the or self.is_local_executor() in the if condition otherwise it will keep retrying. I propose we change this if condition such that its something like so that we return immediately if buildtest build --retry is not specified and the section below would be logic for retry. if not self._retry or ret == 0: return command We should also change this line from 1 to None as the default. https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/6b6277ce0429acb1b0edd332e253233c24789745/buildtest/builders/base.py#L111. There is a retry method that is used to get the value from the command line in this method https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/6b6277ce0429acb1b0edd332e253233c24789745/buildtest/builders/base.py#L326-L327 In the main build.py for every builder we pass the value of the command line buildtest build --retry to each builder if that makes sense. https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/6b6277ce0429acb1b0edd332e253233c24789745/buildtest/cli/build.py#L1123 What this means we should expect the following
If we invoke buildtest build without --retry the test should run once regardless if test pass or fails If --retry is specified we should only retry test that fails (i.e non-zero returncode) X number of times.
To add the regression test i would suggest you do the following
Update the logic in https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/devel/buildtest/builders/base.py to change the way retry works Add test method in class TestBuildTest to https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/devel/tests/cli/test_build.py
Commented on #1445 Add code coverage for injecting modules on command line

HINT
Add your test method https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/devel/tests/cli/test_build.py and invoke the BuildTest class. It has method arguments to pass the modules.
Commented on #1444 Add code coverage for method _process_compiler_config

take a look at these
Documentation example https://buildtest.readthedocs.io/en/devel/buildspecs/compiler.html#running-stream-benchmark-with-multiple-compilers Use this example https://github.com/buildtesters/buildtest/blob/devel/examples/compilers/stream_example.yml for testing
Closed #38488 scalapack missing in e4s-23.05 branch
Commented on #38488 scalapack missing in e4s-23.05 branch
ok i just realized there is no such package name scalapack its a virtual provider. so netlib-scalapack would be one of the providers.
Commented on #38488 scalapack missing in e4s-23.05 branch
i also see this is not present in devel branch https://github.com/spack/spack/tree/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/scalapack what happen did package get removed?
Opened #38488 scalapack missing in e4s-23.05 branch
